noun.description: An interview for a particular role or job as a singer, actor, dancer, or musician, consisting of a practical demonstration of the candidate's suitability and skill.

examples: he was auditioning for the lead role in the play

origin: Late 16th century (in the sense power of hearing or listening): from Latin auditio(n-), from audire hear. Sense 1 of the noun dates from the late 19th century.
